incidents.name: Twilio Conversations Affected

incident_updates.body: Twilio Conversations was degraded for 7 minutes between 16:08 and 16:15 Pacific Time. During this period of time, customers may have received 500 Error Responses from Conversations API and potentially in the Conversations SDK. This issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: On Call Engineers are Investigating an issue with Studio

incident_updates.body: Any customer who has Gather widget and had English (United States) as the gather_language were noticing higher number of 13331 errors. Studio was fully functional during that time and customer functionality was not impacted. Issue has been resolved.

Any customer who has Gather widget and had English (United States) as the gather_language were noticing higher number of 13331 errors. Studio was fully functional during that time and customer functionality was not impacted. Users should see fewer 13331 errors with the gather widget regardless of gather_language selected. We are monitoring to ensure that the service remains unimpacted.

Our engineering team has identified an issue with studio and is working on mitigating the issue. Any customers who have the Gather widget and who have "English (United States)" are impacted. 

Most existing customers have "en-US" or "en set", however because of a previous UI bug any new flows created or modified during Feb 20 2025 to March 12 2025 were defaulted to "English (United States)" as the gather_language and would be impacted. 

Engineers are working to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours, or as soon as we have new information.

We have detected a potential issue with Studio while using the Gather Widget. Our engineering team has identified the issue and is working on mitigating the issue. We will update within 1 hour or as soon as it is mitigated.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue Studio. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Rare occurrences of duplicate sentences in Voice Intelligence transcripts

incident_updates.body: We are no longer experiencing failure that impacts a small number of transcripts created since 02/18/2025 where customers may have received duplicate sentences in their transcript results. Our engineers fixed all transcripts created during this period. This incident has been resolved.

TwilioVoice Intelligenceengineering team is investigating a condition that impacts a small number of transcripts created since 02/18/2025. During this period of time customers may have received duplicate sentences in their transcript results if they have multiple operator results for that sentence. Our engineers are working to resolve the issue. The fix will apply to all transcripts created during this period. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue Sentences and results are being duplicated in Transcript objects. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: 5xx Responses Using Programmable Messaging API

incident_updates.body: The Twilio Programmable Messaging API was partially degraded for 1 minute between 05:01 to 05:02 Pacific Time on 03/17/2025. During this period of time, customers sending messages may have received 5xx's in API responses or experienced brief delays (less than 15 seconds) with message sending. The issue has now been resolved.

The Twilio Programmable Messaging API was partially degraded for 1 minute between 05:01 to 05:02 Pacific Time on 03/17/2025. During this period of time, customers sending messages may have received 5xx's in API responses or experienced brief delays (less than 15 seconds) with message sending. The issue has now been resolved.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: SMS Delivery Delays to AWN/AIS Networks in Thailand

incident_updates.body: During investigation by our engineers, message delivery to the AWN/AIS Networks in Thailand is confirmed to be operating as expected due to the routing of international long code numbers to numeric Sender IDs required. Pre-registration of Alphanumeric Sender ID is suggested to optimize delivery. This incident has been resolved.

We continue to experience SMS delivery delays when sending messages to AWN/AIS Networks in Thailand. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Incorrect Data on Deactivations API for 2025-03-05

incident_updates.body:
Twilio has identified a large number of incorrect entries in the Deactivation API for March 5th, 2025. We are working with the carrier to identify the corrected list. To avoid further customer impact, we have removed the incorrect file until we can replace it with a corrected one. 

When querying 2025-03-05 on the Deactivations API, you will receive a 20404 error response.

incidents.name: Issue with Purchasing International Phone Numbers with a Primary Customer Profile

incident_updates.body: Twilio customers may have experience 5xx errors while trying to purchase international phone numbers with an approved primary customer profile. This impact was visible from 3/13 to 3/17. This issue was identified by our team and resolved on 3/18. There is no current impact to purchasing international numbers.

incidents.name: Intermittent SMS/MMS Deliverability Issues to AT&T Due to Incorrect Deactivation Data

incident_updates.body: Twilio experienced degraded service on a subset of US short codes for approximately 48 hours between March 5th and March 7th, 2025. During this period, customers may have experienced message delivery failures to AT&T numbers due to certain numbers being incorrectly marked as deactivated in the operators data file. The issue has been resolved as of March 7th at 13:34 UTC.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with number deactivation. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.
